Incident.Summary: Vehicle collusion, the operator showed signs of impairment. The operator was transported to FHH for injuries, and consented to a blood draw.

IncidentSuppNarrative.NarrativeText:
CAR- B23 // Body Worn Camera available // In Car Camera not available

Assisting Troopers & Officers // Cpl. Rishell #5730 and Deputy Lawson #579 / BWC's available

 Defendant: Gary William Nelson Jr.          
  • Date of Birth: 05/03/1976
  • Date of Arrest: April 2nd, 2023
  • Time of Arrest: 0121 Hours
  • License#: N425271887339 / MD
ATTACHMENTS:
  • DR15
  • MSP Form 034
  • MVA printouts
  • ACRS
  • Five (5) digital photographs

CERTIFICATIONS AND TRAINING
* I am a certified Police Officer in the State of Maryland with over 40 hours of training in DUI detection at the Maryland State Police Academy. The training included classroom instruction, practical application, alcohol workshops, written testing and practical application examination. I have been trained in Advanced Roadside Impaired Driving Enforcement (ARIDE). 

 VEHICLE IN MOTION (PHASE 1)

    On 04/02/2023, at approximately 0022 hours, Cpl. Rishell and I responded to the area of MD Route 180 (Jefferson National Pike), and Mt. Zion Rd. for a reported single vehicle collision. Maryland State Police (MSP) dispatch advised it was reported the operator of the vehicle was possibly intoxicated, and walking away from the scene. A description of the male involved in the collusion was obtained and broadcasted for a lookout. It should be noted MSP dispatched advised it was reported to be a white male with long hair, and blood "dripping" from his face.

    Due to my extended estimated arrival time, Frederick County Sheriff's Office (FCSO) deputies responded to the scene to assist and located the driver of the vehicle at approximately 0025 hours. Cpl. Rishell then arrived on-scene. Cpl. Rishell advised the driver/sole occupant of the vehicle, Gary William Nelson Jr. (W/M 05/03/1976) was located by Deputy Lawson near the accident scene. Gary was identified by his name/date of birth, and MVA photograph.

    Cpl. Rishell informed me Gary had a bleeding cut on the top of his forehead. Cpl. Rishell also advised he detected a strong odor of an alcoholic beverage emitting from Gary's breath and person. Cpl. Rishell advised he asked Gary how much alcohol he has had to drink, and Gary advised "Probably too much". Cpl. Rishell informed me Gary advised him he was driving from his house, and going to a friend's house.

    Due to Gary's visible head wound. EMS responded to the scene and transported Gary to the Frederick Health Hospital (FHH).

    Damage and evidence on-scene revealed the vehicle Gary was operating, a red Mercury Cougar bearing WV registration, "D1K552" was traveling east on MD 180, west of Mt. Zion Road. Damage showed the vehicle traveled off the right side of the roadway, striking a guardrail and curb. The vehicle then traveled straight through the round-about intersection, striking the center median curb continuing straight (east). The vehicle then struck another guardrail on the east side if the intersection, where it came to a stop. Five (5) digital photographs of the scene are attached to this report.

PERSONAL CONTACT (PHASE 2)

    I responded to FHH to continue the investigation and arrived at approximately 0056. I made contact with Gary inside the hospital. I observed Gary bleeding from the top of his head. I asked Gary what happened. Gary initially advised he did not know, and then advised he became really upset. I asked Gary if anyone else was in the vehicle with him, and he stated, "no". I asked Gary where he was trying to drive too. Gary advised he was in North Carolina and that was all he remembers. I asked Gary if he knew what state he was in, and he advised South Carolina. Gary's speech was low, slow, and slightly slurred. I detected a strong odor of an alcoholic beverage emitting from his breath/person. I asked Gary how much alcohol he has had to drink. Gary advised "a couple drinks". I asked Gary what kind of drinks, and he advised "a couple beers". Gary advised he did not know when his last beer was. I asked Gary if he remembers driving, and he initially advised no. Gary then advised he did remember driving. Gary advised he was in a parking lot, and that he "was gonna pull over". Gary advised that was all that he remembered. I asked Gary if I could see his eye's which he allowed. I observed Gary's eyes glassy and bloodshot.

(PRE-ARREST SCREENING PHASE 3)

    Due to Gary's head wound, and condition he was not requested to preform Standardized Field Sobriety Tests.

    Gary was then advised his advice of rights (DR15) for a draw of his blood. After being advised his rights, Gary stated, "I guess you can draw my blood". I informed Gary it is a yes or no answer, and he stated, "yes". I asked Gary if he would be able to sign the DR15 form. Gary advised yes but did not open his eyes and stated, "HA HA". Gary also had dry blood on both his hands. Due to Gary's condition I wrote "Not able to sign / Refused to sign" on the DR15.

    Gary's blood was drawn at approximately 0121 hours by RN Kelley Hoffman. Gary's blood was then packaged and stored according to MSP policy. I then responded to the MSP Frederick barrack. Gary's blood samples were then sent to the Maryland State Police (MSP) Chemical Test for Alcohol Unit (CTAU) for analysis for blood alcohol content (BAC). Gary was left under the care of hospital staff.

All events occurred in Frederick County MD.

CASE STATUS: Open pending laboratory analysis.

NARRATIVE:

    As of the date of this supplemental report, I am still awaiting the laboratory analysis for this case. 

CASE STATUS: This case remains open pending laboratory analysis.

ATTACHMENTS:

- Alcohol Blood Test Results 23-CTB-154 (Gary William Nelson Jr.)

NARRATIVE:

    On 8/17/2023, I received the alcohol blood test results from the MSP Chemical Test for Alcohol Unit (CTAU) via email. The results indicated Gary William Nelson Jr. (W/M 5/3/1976) had a blood alcohol concentration of 0.19 at the time the blood was collected. 

    On 8/19/2023, I attempted to serve Gary with the paperwork associated with this case with negative results. I attempted to contact Gary at, 23 Petersville Rd. Brunswick MD 21716 which Gary advised was his current address during the date of the collision. I contacted Gary's mother at this residence, and she advised he no longer resides there. Gary's mother was unable to provide me with any current contact information for him, and was unaware of his current whereabouts. I attempted to contact Gary via telephone, and at two (2) separate residences which were associated with him with negative results.

    I then completed an application for charges, and submitted them to the Frederick County District Court Commissioner's Office. The requested charges are listed below.

- Driving vehicle while under the influence of alcohol, Driving vehicle while impaired by alcohol, Driving vehicle while under the influence of alcohol PER SE, Reckless driving, Negligent driving, Failure to control vehicle speed to avoid a collision, Failure to drive right of center, and Failure to obey properly placed traffic control device.

All events occurred in Frederick County MD.

CASE STATUS: I request this case be suspended pending the service of charges.

BWC / IN CAR CAMERA AVAILABLE - B13

ATTACHMENTS:
- Arrest Warrant
- DR 15 A

NARRATIVE:

    On 8/20/2023, I received an arrest warrant for Gary William Nelson Jr. (W/M 5/3/1976) from the Frederick County District Court Commissioner's Office for this case (Warrant Control #: D230157270 / Case No. SE22136). A copy of the warrant is attached to this supplemental report.

    At approximately 1218 hours, I arrested Gary at the MSP Frederick Barracks located at 110 Airport Dr. E. Frederick MD 21701. Gary was polite and cooperative. Gary was then transported to the Frederick County Adult Detention Center, and served with the warrant along with paperwork related to this case. Gary was released to the custody of the detention center. 

All events occurred in Frederick County MD.

CASE STATUS: Closed by arrest.
